node.name: Therenborough Chapel, Interior
node.description: The city's tiny chapel is a simple square room furnished with polished oak pews facing a raised altar. The small stained-glass window over the entry door casts a subdued light upon the altar, causing the embroidery on the altar cloth to sparkle with a silky bluish glow. A single brass candlestick rests in the middle of the cloth.
The city's tiny chapel is a simple square room furnished with polished oak pews facing a raised altar.

The city's tiny chapel is a simple square room furnished with polished oak pews facing a raised altar. The small stained-glass window over the entry door sparkles with candle light and casts a subdued light upon the altar, causing the embroidery on the altar cloth to glow with a silky bluish tint. A single brass candlestick rests in the middle of the cloth.
The city's tiny chapel is a simple square room furnished with polished oak pews facing a raised altar.

node.name: Church, Rear Garden
node.description: A profusion of delicate lacy vines grows over the rough stone wall that separates the chapel from the rest of the town. Tall, fragrant evergreen bushes have been grown and shaped to form a deep bower on the east side of the garden. A white cobblestone path bordered with sweet-smelling flowers leads from the chapel to the bower.

node.name: Chapel, Bower
node.description: The branches of the evergreens curve and arch about above, as welcoming as a loved one's embrace. Maiden's Breath vines twine in delicate patterns through the dark green foliage of the bushes, filling the bower with the sweet, heady perfume of their blossoms.

node.name: Church, Cleric's Room
node.description: A humble cot spread with meticulously clean linen sheets dominates this tiny room. At the foot of the cot is a large iron bound chest. In one corner is a hearth with a neatly stacked assortment of food preparation utensils sitting to one side and a pile of firewood at the other. A table pushed close to the bed seems to serve as a desk as well as eating area for the room's occupant.

Dim light filters through a round window placed near the ceiling, casting faded shadows about the room. Open-beamed and devoid of partitions, the attic has a feeling of spaciousness missing in the chapel below. Except for a small bookcase and a few storage trunks the place is empty, and noises bounce around the room in faint, hollow echoes.

node.name: Chapel, Attic
node.description: Hazy, yellow light filters through a round window placed near the ceiling, casting an eerie glow about the room. Open-beamed and devoid of partitions, the attic has a feeling of spaciousness missing in the chapel below. Except for a small bookcase and a few storage trunks the place is empty, and noises bounce around the room in faint, hollow echoes.

Dim light filters through a round window placed near the ceiling, casting faded shadows about the room. Open-beamed and devoid of partitions, the attic has a feeling of spaciousness missing in the chapel below. Except for a small bookcase and a few storage trunks the place is empty, and noises bounce around the room in faint, hollow echoes.

node.name: Therenborough Inn, Sunken Fireplace
node.description: A brightly snapping fire of cedar logs burns in the red brick fireplace. Recessed below the level of the common room, the fireplace hearth provides a quiet spot for rest and conversation. Thickly furred animal pelts spread across the floor in front of the fire allow the weary traveler to recline in comfort. Steps lead back up to the common room.

node.name: Piny Pleasures, Foyer
node.description: A strong scent of fresh-cut pine permeates the air, so pungent it almost makes the eyes water. Sawdust covers the entire floor in a layer at least a hand deep, most of it white in color, though a strip emanating from the shop's entrance has been packed flat into a discolored brown.

node.name: Piny Pleasures, Tables
node.description: Tables of all shapes and sizes, all of them crafted from various types of pine, line the walls. All of the pieces appear newly-created, their surfaces dust-free.

node.name: Piny Pleasures, Odds-n-Ends
node.description: Large piles of wooden blocks, only the occasional piece recognizable as furniture, squat upon every inch of the floor. Everything has a price tag, though it's not entirely clear all the items in the room were originally intended to look the way they do.

node.name: Piny Pleasures, Floors
node.description: Long stripes of pine paneling hang from the walls, samples of flooring which Piny Pleasures has available for installation. Each piece sports a small tag denoting its price.

node.name: Piny Pleasures, Beds
node.description: Dozens of pine bed frames sit in neat, ordered rows, each awaiting an owner.

node.name: Piny Pleasures, Walls
node.description: The walls of this room are divided into neatly ordered sections, each paneled in a different type of pine. A sales clerk waits expectantly in one corner, eyeing patrons carefully as they enter and exit his domain.

node.name: Piny Pleasures, Doors
node.description: Large piles of sawdust cover the floor of this obviously unused room.

node.name: Piny Pleasures, Chairs
node.description: The ever-present fragrance of freshly-stripped pine mingles in the air with a faint scent of amber polishing oil in this cluttered display area. Stacks of chairs and stools lean against the walls, balanced carefully behind rows of sturdy pine benches which barely manage to contain the tangle of carved pine arms and legs.

node.name: Midwife's Cottage, Porch
node.description: A swing of smoothly sanded honey pine sways gently at the end of the covered porch. Near the front door of the cottage, a padded rocker beckons with promises of a comfortable rest. Wide steps lead down to the village road.

node.name: Midwife's Cottage, Front Room
node.description: The stringent smell of crushed herbs pervades the front room of the cottage. Shelves positioned above a large, well-scrubbed pine table hold a neat assortment of jars and bottles that seem to be the source of the smell. Across from the table is a tall white cabinet, two chairs, and a cot spread with clean white sheets, standing ready for use.

node.name: Midwife's Cottage, Hallway
node.description: A thick rag rug runs down the hallway, coming to a stop at an arched opening at the end of the passage. Wooden doors, each the home of an Empath or midwife-in-training apprenticing to the building's owner, line the walls.

node.name: Midwife's Cottage, Storage Closet
node.description: Long cedar planks form shelving along both sides of this small closet. Neat stacks of blankets and linen sheets cover most of the storage space but a few large portable basins are stacked on the bottom shelves.

node.name: Smithy, Front Yard
node.description: A large oak tree looms tall here in the yard of one of the town's smithies, providing shade for a small work area built into one corner. A simple brick forge is built up against the low-lying stone wall, and nearby stands a sturdy anvil and a heavy oak worktable.

node.name: Smithy, Storage Shed
node.description: This long, narrow building appears to be a storage area for the Blacksmith's tools and finished projects. Wide metal shelves running along two opposite walls of the shed frame a narrow aisle down the center of the room. Several larger implements have been hung from hooks nailed to the rafters above. To the south lies a door.

node.name: Therenborough Town Stable, Barn
node.description: Thin barred windows raised high on exterior walls do little to illuminate this darkened shelter, securely built from thick wood planks. Parallel rows of narrow stalls, split by an aisle covered with a blanket of fresh straw, provide safe haven for all manner of beasts of burden. Off to the north is the corral, housing animals in need of exercise while boarded.

node.name: Therenborough Town Stable, Corral
node.description: A pair of buildings face each other across an expanse of hoof-packed earth. Encircling the area is a split rail fence enclosing a large corral that secures any animals left behind by equestrians going about their chores. The larger of the two buildings, an outpost for the Therengian Cavalry, is built from stacked logs, while the second more modest structure houses the stable's business office, where deals are made and goods of all kinds can be purchased.

node.name: Therenborough Town Stable, Business Office
node.description: Whitewashed walls do little to brighten up the small space whose haphazard decor suggests it's used for all sorts of random deals. Cradling the corner, a sturdy desk is piled high with ledgers, doing little to hide the chipped finish of the surface and that of the chair neatly tucked behind the desk. A collection of straw-lined boxes, crates and chests are casually stacked across the room, keeping all edible treasures safe from hungry rodents.

node.name: Therenborough Town Stable, Cavalry Outpost
node.description: This rustic outpost is spacious enough to house the regiments that form the Therengian Cavalry, allowing boisterous meetings to be held outside the Keep so as not to disturb the Baron's day-to-day activities. Silk banners representing each troop adorn the wall behind a podium, adding a colorful background. Benches, chairs and unclaimed saddles perched on stands offer seating near a table filled with refreshments, set out to fortify hard-working patrols that wander in at all hours.

node.name: Therenborough Town Stable, Cavalry Barracks
node.description: Precisely furnished for the comfort of the Baron's horsemen, this long chamber is kept neat despite signs of frequent use. Horsehair mattresses pad field cots lining the length of one wall, each one fitted with a standard issue blanket and pillow. Small mirrors hang behind serviceable dry sinks, meticulously set with washbasins, pitchers and a variety of toiletries. Ending the wide aisle splitting the room, a table and chairs await any guardsmen unable to sleep who choose to relax with a game of cards.

node.name: Baronial Tournament Arena, Royal Gallery
node.description: Safe and secure from the crush of competition on the jousting field below, royal blue and gold cushions adorn the benches gathered in small groupings along the tiered boxes of the viewing gallery. A slight curve in the highly polished banister prevents excited spectators from tumbling out of the stands while cheering on their champions of choice. Banners emblazoned with the crests of several noble houses of Therengia lend a sense of regal festivity to the thrill of competition.

node.name: Therenborough, Gizgo's Engraving
node.description: A short pine counter divides Gizgo's work area from the rest of his shop. Bleached animal hides, upon which are drawn carefully crafted engraving patterns, are nailed along the back wall of the shop. Near the front is a menu board listing all the patterns that Gizgo currently offers to potential customers.

node.name: Empath Home
node.description: The cottage has an air of peacefulness, though sounds of weeping and the occasional scream conquer other sounds. Cushions and rugs cover the floor offering much appreciated comfort to the patients. Bloody bandages piled in a corner show how many people depend on this empath's services. Blood-spattered walls mount paintings of empaths on battlefields healing the wounded. A young woman glides across the room examining each patient in silence, occasionally touching one lightly and moving on.

node.name: Therenborough, Market Square
node.description: Blue and white canopied stalls displaying bountiful baskets of produce nestle between quaint shops with flower-filled window boxes. The square is crowded with people and filled with the noise of conversation and the shouts of merchants hawking their wares. Hearthwives ladened with mesh shopping bags push aggressively forward as they vie with each other for the best produce.

Blue and white canopied stalls, shuttered closed for the night, nestle between quaint shops with flower-filled window boxes. The square is much quieter in the evening hours, with only murmurs of quiet conversation breaking the silence.

node.name: Therenborough, Market Square
node.description: Granite cobblestones line the lane, making travel easy for shoppers strolling by as well as traders delivering their wares. Merchants display their specialties in the windows of small shops, painted in an array of candy-like pastel colors, hoping to attract customers as they engage in the daily battle for business in the competitive market. Songbirds flit about the branches of a large cherry tree, entertaining the local children, as they remain safely hidden by its abundant leaves.

Throughout the evening, ambitious merchants bathe their window displays in golden candlelight, hoping to attract customers too busy to shop during the day. An occasional click of heels echoes off the cobblestones, breaking through the dark's silence as a lone guard strolls by on his nightly patrol, stopping only to duck behind the trunk of a large cherry tree for a quick smoke before resuming his rounds.

node.name: Therenborough, Market Square
node.description: A tall cherry tree shades the lane on summer days, its trunk scarred from the shoes of local children who've climbed it just to see if they can. Mixing with the everyday scents of the busy marketplace, a lingering aroma of freshly baked goods drifts through the air, drawing customers further along the lane.

Shops lit to fight off the dark cast a golden glow, bouncing off a tall cherry tree to create a parade of shadows dancing across the lane that continues throughout the evening. An occasional rustle of leaves indicates that not all visitors to the marketplace go home at night to sleep.

node.name: Fit for a Baron, Display
node.description: Hanging high from the opaque ceiling are bright lights that glint off the armor displays. Tapestries and heavy curtains cover the ironwood walls while plush snowbeast fur rugs line the marble floor. Stands line the walls and mannequins fill the corners of the room.

node.name: Elanthian Travel Tours, Gift Shop
node.description: Poles hold up a brightly covered canvas awning that can be lowered when the shop is closed. An oversized tower shield with a small plaque is in a roped area in the corner. Hooks loaded with wares hang near a counter that blocks customers from rifling through the unopened boxes and crates piled in the shadows.

node.name: Gretchen's Hats, Workshop
node.description: An array of silk flowers, satin and grosgrain ribbons, wooden berries and chiffon scarves spread across the polished granite slab that covers a row of maple cupboards. The hatmaker Gretchen Abernathy sits at the workspace, a fanciful hat adorned with bright wooden strawberries and green silk leaves in her hand. Boldly patterned rugs crisscross the floor below her, and handpainted flowerpots cluster in the corners.

node.name: Sweet Delights, Front Room
node.description: A comfortable, homey clutter fills this pleasant shop giving it a relaxed, lived-in atmosphere. Mismatched pitchers and jugs cover the shelf-lined walls, and rows of tapered candles hang from the top of the window frames. The pale blue of a magnificent wisteria growing outside the back window is reflected in the sky blue walls of the shop. Several regular patrons sit over endless cups of coffee discussing other people's love lives.

node.name: Therenborough Gardens, Blue Garden
node.description: The initial impression here is one of flowerbeds lavishly planted with brilliant blue, but on closer examination the artful blending of mauve, purple and varying shades of blue can be seen. Midnight blue clematis climb through the cheerful blue globular blossoms of giant thistle, while pale mauve geranium and purple-leafed plantain cover the ground. A marble statue stands in the center, overlooking the floral display.

node.name: Therenborough Gardens, Yellow Garden
node.description: Sunny yellow jonquils and orange marigolds grow around a small pond where large goldfish swim, their long trailing fins creating golden shimmers just below the water's surface. A group of stone nymphs frolic at the edge of the pond.

node.name: Therenborough Gardens, White Garden
node.description: A higher elevation sets off this tranquil garden planted with simple patterns of lilies, white roses and pale feathergrasses. A charming white trelliswork pavilion stands open at the far end. The subdued planting of pale flowers high above the other gardens gives this area an ethereal feeling.

node.name: Pavilion
node.description: Neatly trimmed trellises dripping with honeysuckle surround a lush lawn on which roses are grown in elaborate, knotted circles. Bees trek merrily about the colorful blooms, oblivious to everything but the task at hand. At each corner of the pavilion, junipers sway majestically with the wind.

node.name: Amphitheatre, Entrance
node.description: These hallowed halls are where the brave come to prove their worth to their gods and peers. The sounds of combat and cheering crowds filter in from the nearby entrance.

node.name: Amphitheatre, Hall of Champions
node.description: The highly polished oaken walls are covered with heroic crests of the brave knights who have won honors in the arena. In each corner stands a lance with multi-hued streamers attached to them.

node.name: Amphitheatre, Viewing Stands
node.description: The many rows of seats encircle and gradually slope downwards to the arena. Most seats are occupied with the local townfolks here to enjoy the combat games. The amphitheatre's design gives each seat a clear view of the entire arena while the perfect acoustics permit even the slightest whisper to be heard from below. Colorful banners drape gracefully from overhead and reach towards the arena below.

node.name: Amphitheatre, Waiting Room
node.description: While designed to be a staging area for combatants of the arena, this room has been converted into a makeshift triage station to keep from having to rush the bleeding wounded through the streets. The pounding excitement of the arena pervades the room.

node.name: Amphitheatre, The Arena
node.description: This open space provides ample room for many combatants to do battle at the same time. Clean white sand covers the hard-packed ground and most of the blood from prior battles. Many multicolored banners trail down from the viewing stands above.

node.name: Therenborough, Kaudric's Gateway
node.description: An alabaster arch stretches over the roadway, its smooth surface carved with elegant words. A brass plate attached to the arch gives directions to various sites in the capital. Nearby can be heard the sound of rushing water.

node.name: Therenborough, Lirum Square
node.description: A small stucco building with a red-tiled roof lies along the outskirts of the massive city square. Displayed in the shop's window are several pieces of clothing, most of which bear the trappings of Therengian court. The bustling square boasts a newly paved roadway, and is named after one of the Barony's idols.

node.name: Therenborough, Lirum Square
node.description: Surrounded by several sets of stained oak benches is a marble fountain filled with clear water pouring from three twin lion's heads. The sounds of children's laughter always present in the days is noticeably absent under the moonlight. Every now and then young lovers stop by the splashing waters of the fountain.

Surrounded by several sets of stained oak benches is a marble fountain filled with clear water pouring from three twin lion's heads. A few children amuse themselves by running along the edge of the fountain, careful to avoid falling in while laughing at each other.

node.name: Therenborough, Lirum Square
node.description: A magnificent limestone building with double doors flanked by marble columns stands proudly before the square. The Gealeranendae College of Magical History, famed throughout the five provinces, welcomes students, visitors, and teachers within its revered halls. Hanging above the walnut doors is a blue banner with gold edging.

node.name: Therenborough, Lirum Square
node.description: Pigeons circle over the marble fountain, some landing and skittering across the ground pecking for food, only to flee back to the air when anything larger than a bug approaches them. To the side of the fountain, a weathered oak tree stretches outward to cosset the clouds, occasionally dropping an acorn as an offering.

node.name: Therenborough, Mercantile Street
node.description: A round little shop stands beside the street, its windows bearing several finely crafted tapestries made from imported Rathan silk. The building's oak door is open, welcoming customers inside. A few birds can be seen flying through the air around the crouching gargoyles of the great keep's towers.

node.name: Therenborough, Mercantile Street
node.description: A paved roadway runs through a collection of small houses topped with red clay tiles. A sturdy metal gate holds a wooden sign with elegant words scrawled in black paint. The wind blows through the colorful acacia trees lining the boulevard, scattering purple and yellow flowers about.

node.name: Therenborough, Mercantile Street
node.description: The broad boulevard passes by a tiny building, its windows tightly shuttered, a sign proclaiming it the home of the mysterious sister Nongwen. Piled outside of the home are rows of wooden crates, all nailed shut. A pile of rubble has been pushed off the side of the roadway.

node.name: Therenborough, Telomin Lane
node.description: A small lane edges between the large edifices of the town's commercial district to halt before the doorway to a limestone building. The rear entrance to the stately Telomin Hall, lights can be seen from within it at all hours, and a careful observer can detect the sounds of discussion and silver clinking against glass.

node.name: Therenborough, Escutcheon Boulevard
node.description: The long Escutcheon Boulevard ends at a massive steel gate breaching a large rock wall. Upon the wall is a gold plaque bearing the crest of Trigomas, one of the wealthier Therengian Houses. In the center of the road is a bronze statue of a young Human male holding a longsword in one hand and a scale in the other. Encircling the statue is a ring of shrubs.

node.name: Therenborough, Mason's Circle
node.description: A painted gateway marks the boundary between paved road and dirt track. Alongside the path stands a weatherbeaten but sturdy stable, a few bundles of hay stacked by the door and a rusted steel pitchfork tossed carelessly to the side.

node.name: Therenborough, Mason's Circle
node.description: Small cottages cling to the stone walls of the city, the ominous shadows of the giant keep looming over them all. The roadway, little more than a dust trail, wanders aimlessly through the homes like a snake, slithering around well-tended gardens and plots of trees.

node.name: Therenborough, Mason's Circle
node.description: Outside one two-story dwelling dozens of children's toys are scattered, with striped red and blue balls, ornate hobbyhorses, and wooden wheels strewn across a fenced-in patch of grass. A sign bearing methodically painted script hangs beside the whitewashed door.

node.name: Therenborough, Mason's Circle
node.description: Off of the packed dirt track, solid brick steps supported by a wooden railing lead up to a noisy building, the sounds of wood being sawed and hammered coming from within. Thick letters engraved on the door proclaim the spot a carpenter's residence.

node.name: Therenborough, Well
node.description: In the midst of tile-roofed houses spewing grey smoke from stone chimneys stands a brick well surrounded by a cobbled walk. Atop the well rests a knotted wooden bucket tied to a thick, worn rope, and a few decorative ceramic pots and vases are placed neatly by the side.

node.name: Therenborough, Escutcheon Boulevard
node.description: A proud bronze lion rears up over the street from the marble pedestal it stands upon, his clawed paw slicing at the air. A small cobbled path leads east from the main roadway, heading into a collection of quaint tile-roofed houses.

node.name: Therenborough, Escutcheon Boulevard
node.description: Stone gargoyles loom above a large building, their faces frozen in snarls or grimaces. Carved into the granite facade of the building are images of ancient heroes of Therengia and the Empire. A massive lancet arch leads within, and above the arch a swan is depicted in meticulous stained glass.

node.name: Therenborough, Mason's Circle
node.description: The cobbled path to the west circles large and elaborate houses, dwindling to a packed dirt road to the east. In the center of the road stands a shining pole clutching a blue banner depicting a seven-pointed star above a tower. Tall hedges line the sides of the road, animal shapes carved into their mass at even intervals.

node.name: Ibec Hall, Foyer
node.description: Broad oak double doors, flanked by a phalanx of fine green marble pillars, lead from the reflectively spotless floors of the austere civic building to the paved streets of Therenborough outside. Walls of brilliant lapis blue marble, marked by tessellated flecks of black and white, offset the promenade of green columns marching from the doors to a long corridor northward. To one side of the entry chamber, a crystalline staircase leads up to the hall's rooftop.

node.name: Ibec Hall, Walk of Heroes
node.description: Lifelike and elaborate statues formed of alabaster, plaster, and bronze stand upon ornate cerulean marble pedestals. Proudly displayed upon each pedestal is a plaque of platinum, gold, or some other valuable material proclaiming the name of the hero and the bold and honorable deeds that earned them an eternal place in this hallowed hall. Bringing a bit of uniqueness to the frozen guardians, each holds something in their right hand.

node.name: Ibec Hall, Walk of Heroes
node.description: Honored heroes, many now shrouded in the mystery of myth and legend, stand guard along the main passageway of this ancient hall, once a Paladin Guild, as though to repel any invader that would attempt to reach the inner sanctum just ahead. Though silent and still, the sculptures are so expertly crafted as to appear ready to leap from their marble pedestals. An elaborate shield mosaic of white and gold embellishes the tile floor.

node.name: Ibec Hall, Sanctum
node.description: The building opens up into a large, circular chamber. Radiant rays of starlight shine through the domed ceiling's glass skylights, exposing the goings-on of the beautiful sanctum to the vigilant eyes of the gods above. The heart of the hall, two arches lead from this chamber to other rooms. Displayed upon the floor in tile mosaic is a black tower with a golden star suspended above it.

node.name: Ibec Hall, Licensing Offices
node.description: Inamicable and surly clerks clad in livery plod about this cramped room leadenly, some delivering documents to the corner of the room, while some march their wards out of the room through a walnut door. A few of the more engaging workers sit at unremarkable desks from which they issue various licenses, writs, and permits. The corner of the room contains a dusty desk occupied by a cadaverous old scribe diligently recording in a massive tome every detail of the lives of the province's populace.

node.name: Ibec Hall, Homes Licensing Office
node.description: This small room is dominated by a walnut table, around which stand two clerks, heavy in their own discussion. Upon the table is a small model of the city, with marks for future expansion, and special attention given to residential areas. A large pile of documents rests beside the model, the scrolls within containing information on citizens and home occupants.

node.name: Ibec Hall, Passport Office
node.description: A finely crafted desk serves as the work space for a bedraggled licenser. On one side of the desk wobbles a stack of documents, each bearing the wax seal of the Baron, granting travel rights throughout the province. A mural of Lake Gwenalion decorates one wall of the room.

node.name: Ibec Hall, Genealogy Office
node.description: Forming a counter that divides the small room is a desk long enough to accommodate additional employees when things get hectic. Everything is kept neat and tidy, from the stacks of record books to the genealogy charts hung along the walls, showing the resident clerk's attention to detail. A padded bench sits near the door, encouraging citizens to sit and wait their turn instead of pacing around the office in hopes of hurrying the bureaucratic process along.

node.name: Ibec Hall, Registrar's Office
node.description: Opposite the cherrywood door that leads within this semi-circular room, a red cherrywood desk serves as the seat of the Chief Registrar. Papers are precisely and neatly arranged upon the surface of the work area, illustrating the northerner's belief in the importance of order, and beside the stacks is an opaline frosted glass bottle filled with some jet liquid.

node.name: Ibec Hall, Registry Records Office
node.description: Highly polished wooden filing cabinets line the walls of this tiny office, leaving no room for frivolous decoration. Piles of neatly stacked papers cover the top of a cherrywood desk that has been positioned to immediately catch the attention of anyone entering the room. The cramped waiting area intentionally lacks furniture, encouraging citizens to take care of business as quickly as possible and be on their way.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Entry Hall
node.description: The polished wooden floors of this large foyer shine with a permanent luster, remaining glossy and unscuffed even by the many pairs of feet which have passed through over the years. A glass display case sits prominently to one side, exhibiting the prestigious certificates and awards of past graduates.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Hallway
node.description: This wide hallway is decorated on both sides with polished wooden cases containing books and manuscripts. A collection of magical artifacts is displayed in a cabinet under protective glass. Nearby, a well-lighted stairwell leads to the academy's lower floor.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Hallway
node.description: Conservative off-white walls, devoid of any decoration, surround you. Thick, lush carpeting covers the floor and provides a damper on outside noise. While starkly functional, there is nevertheless a feeling of security. A thick oak door leads to the college's library.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Instructors' Office
node.description: The musky scent of fine pipe tobacco permeates this small office, which is blanketed with richly woven Ilithi carpets. Across from the doorway sit a sturdy cherrywood desk and polished leather chair, and a stuffed owl with glass eyes perches on an engraved shelf to one side.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Lecture Hall
node.description: A cavernous lecture hall stretches outward from a set of huge double doors with glossy curved handles. Rows of seats extend down the aisles to a high stage platform at the front, each chair with a small wooden table resting on the arm for ease in taking notes.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Recitation Room
node.description: This small classroom looks to have been designed for a modestly sized recitation class. Several desks cluster in the center of the room and a large white ash rack hangs on the far wall. Across from it is a slate board covered with arcane scribblings in various colors of chalk.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Registrar's Office
node.description: Every available flat surface in the office has been piled high with stacks of forms. Along one wall is a row of large cabinets with several drawers pulled haphazardly open, spilling more paper into the chaos of the room. A harried-looking clerk works busily behind the desk.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Library
node.description: Tall oaken book cases line the walls of this enclosed room, giving off a pleasant woody scent which permeates the air. Worn leather chairs are set at a large oak table, providing a place to read in comfort.

node.name: Gaeleranendae College, Dormitories
node.description: The wood panel floors are polished to a lustrous shine, their surface unblemished by any marks. Decorating the blue wall is an oak-framed painting of the city of Therenborough, and beneath the painting hangs a wooden sign. A carpeted staircase leads to the rest of the school.

node.name: Gaeleranendae College, Dormitories
node.description: The hallway, painted in pale blue hues, is dimly lit by candles held in wall sconces. Along the walls hang portraits of notable figures from the college's history. By one of the doors, there is some faint scuffing of the paint, as if scratched at by something.

node.name: Gaeleranendae College, Dormitories
node.description: Outside one dormitory room rests a glass tray, an earthenware jug and bowl and some silver utensils piled neatly on top of it. An oil painting of the Zaulfung Stones hanging from a brass hook in the wall is slightly tilted at an odd angle.

node.name: Gaeleranendae College, Dormitories
node.description: Muffled sounds come from behind one door. Harsh whisperings, the metallic jingle of coins, and the rattle of dice in a cup can all be heard, though the noises cease after a brief shuffling every time rapping footsteps pass down the hallway outside.

node.name: Gaeleranendae College, Dormitories
node.description: At the hallway's end stands a gold pedestal bearing a bust of the college's founder, and a blue tapestry bearing the Gaeleranandae crest covers the wall above the bust. Like a cloak, a thick rug made from the fur of an island desumos lies on the floor.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Downstairs
node.description: The small room is bare save for a series of hooks lining the plain whitewashed walls, from which hang various-sized drab smocks stained by unknown substances for academy students to borrow. A tall scuffed cabinet in one corner contains several emergency medical kits and various pieces of safety equipment. An unlit staircase leads below.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Magic Lab
node.description: Scrolls and grimoires containing detailed descriptions of myriad spells fill the cabinets of this stone-walled lab, enclosed behind thick glass doors layered for protection against magical accidents. A large cambrinth sphere rests atop a stone pillar in the center of the room, and several unfinished runestones are scattered across a small bench to one side.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Alchemy Lab
node.description: The walls of this spacious laboratory are lined with large cabinets containing empty jars, mixing bowls, and various alchemical supplies. A huge worktable dominates nearly half of the room, providing ample space for students and professors to work safely side by side. In the corner a small water bin rests beside a pile of stacked unlonchai buckets.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Storage Room
node.description: Dust blankets this cramped underground storage space like the snowy quilt of winter upon a pale field. Wooden crates, securely nailed shut and decorated with vivid red paint, clutter the basement and make moving about difficult. Nestled between two wobbling stacks of yellow and faded books, an obviously once-ornate altar shows the effects of brutal age and underground damp.

node.name: Gealeranendae College, Tear of Grazhir Exhibit
node.description: Rising and vanishing into darkness, the circular walls are home to four marble gargoyles that stare balefully from their perches at the silvery-white shard imbedded deeply into the floor's center. A single plaque of brass and silver is fastened in the stones near the exit. Otherwise unadorned, the room is thick with shadows, no sconces or torches to help shed illumination.

node.name: Phelim's Sanctum, Tear of Grazhir
node.description: A sprawling mosaic of bright colors has been tiled into the floor and spirals outwards in a tremendous sunburst shape from the center of the room. Though this may be a design feature solely to further enhance the remarkable brilliance of the design, nothing else here displays such shades and hues, as the walls and ceiling are a drab blue. A tiny white shard of mineral lies in the center of the mosaic.

node.name: Courtly Styles, Main Sales Room
node.description: Velvet draperies on the walls have been pulled back to frame luxurious tapestries. Plush burgundy carpet muffles the footfalls of customers and sales staff. Racks and stands have been neatly lined in front of a long mahogany counter with a marble top. Platinum-based candelabras stand in each corner of the room, shedding a soft light on the wares.

node.name: Courtly Styles, Women's Parlor
node.description: Painted in a soft rose and edged with a moss-green ivy border, this room is decidedly feminine. Chairs with chintz-covered pillows and lace doilies are a resting place for weary shoppers or bored spouses. Racks of clothing have been placed about the room, showing off the fine fabrics and colors to their best advantage.

node.name: Courtly Styles, Men's Study
node.description: Dark stained paneling and thick velvet drapes make the lanterns in the corners of the room necessary. Plush leather chairs and a solid brass spittoon in the corner are signs of the masculine customers this room caters to. A large bloodwood armoire and clothes racks are refilled by silent clerks as the wares are bought.

node.name: Paintings and Tapestries for the Distinguished
node.note: Paintings and Tapestries for the Distinguished
node.description: The drab stone walls of the shop are given dazzling color by an assortment of tapestries and banners hanging throughout. Resting to one side, a solid table displays a loom alongside bolts of smooth, regal silk and a bundle of thick wool. Carefully arranged near the material on the wooden tabletop are glass jars of oils, paints and dyes.

node.name: Theren Cleric Shop
node.description: Sturdy oaken shelves, wicker baskets, and a wooden counter display a variety of clerical wares and necessities in the shop of Sister Nongwen. The air is heavy with smoke from sputtering oil lanterns and incense burners that flicker eerily, casting dark shadows on the shuttered windows. Bundles of herbs and wild grasses hang from exposed rafters, partially obscuring a dimly lit corner of the store.

node.name: Sister Nongwen's Back Room
node.description: Neatly kept, this tiny room serves as both living quarters and an additional storeroom. A small cot and a cooking stove designate one corner as the home, while the rest of the room is stacked to the ceiling with boxes and crates placed here in storage.

node.name: Sister Nongwen's Garden
node.description: Several troughs filled with colorful herbs and flowering plants growing from rich soil are aligned in orderly rows. A weather-worn wooden bucket filled with well water rests on the cobblestone walkway next to one of the troughs. A sturdy oak door marred by the elements leads to the back room of the shop.

node.name: Sister Nongwen's Garden
node.description: A whitewashed wooden fence encases the small back yard, with muffled sounds from the surrounding buildings and homes of the city drifting in over the painted enclosure. The herbs growing in the troughs in this area have thick stems with sharp thorns.

node.name: Sister Nongwen's Garden
node.description: Wicker baskets bearing rare and precious herbs hang from a tall oak tree shading the cobbled path. Encircling the large trunk are several racks filled with tiny glass bottles of pastes, powders, and dried herbs.

node.name: Sister Nongwen's Garden
node.description: Off to the side of the cobblestone walkway stands a low brick wall protecting the jewel of Sister Nongwen's garden, a plot of dirt containing several different varieties of sirese flowers. Wooden poles around the wall support a cloth roof that protects the fragile buds from damage due to inclement weather.

node.name: Therenborough, Derelict's Alley
node.description: Uneven and disheveled from irregular settling, the cobblestones are certainly in need of repair, or at least a good flattening to make the alley passable for delivery carts. By the look of the surrounding buildings and homes, however, few if any deliveries are made here, and the ever present shadows -- which a cutpurse could easily make use of -- may be partly to blame.

node.name: Therenborough, Alley's End
node.description: Waves of some heady scent ripple through the alleyway, and though no drafts or breezes are apparently the cause of such an olfactory undulation, the street debris and discards of Therenborough life are obviously the source of odor. The proximity of this alley to the north end of the moat also most certainly has something to do with the assault on the nostrils, but sight of it is hidden by the backs of buildings, shops and homes, their windows and doors sealed to this seedy back street.

node.name: Telomin Hall, Sitting Room
node.description: The mellow smell of woodsmoke permeates this mahogany-paneled room, coming from the massive limestone fireplace that dominates the far wall. Flames dance around the large oak logs that pop and crackle behind the hearth's mesh screen. Tall chairs with plush velvet seats are arranged in groupings around the hearth. A stunning tapestry covers the length of wall above the roaring fire. A large burgundy couch sits back away from the fire somewhat, giving the room a slightly cooler spot to sit.

node.name: Telomin Hall, Conference Chamber
node.description: The deep luster of the wood-paneled walls is accented by the rich hues of the burgundy and blue tapestries hung about the room, creating a tasteful and sedate atmosphere. A thickly padded burgundy rug mutes the conversations taking place here. Several mahogany sitting tables and chairs run down the center of the room, providing a place for the elite to rest and discuss the events of the day. Dozens of candles in wall sconces and silver candelabra cast a soft glow across the chamber.

node.name: Telomin Hall, Foyer
node.description: Twin silver candelabra flank the heavy oak door leading outside, beside viridescent stone pillars. Plush burgundy carpeting covers the floor from wood-paneled wall to wood-paneled wall. A noticeable hush hangs throughout the vestibule, as if the slightest whisper would disturb the hanging blue tapestries. A polished wooden table, small but ornate, rests near the doorway, a leather-bound register and frosted glass ink pot upon it.

node.name: Telomin Hall, Dining Hall
node.description: A broad table in the center of this restrained room is covered by a fringed white cloth, food and drink arranged neatly and precisely upon it for the perusal of guests. The smells of the freshly baked breads and cooked meats and sauces waft through the air. Several antique suits of armor stand to one side of the room atop a burgundy rug, where groups of people occasionally stop to chat about current events, and an opulent blue chair is provided for comfort. A narrow hallway leads out.

node.name: Telomin Hall, Ballroom
node.description: Brilliant gold chandeliers hang from the ceiling, light from the candle flames reflecting off of the myriad crystals decorating the fixtures. The floor shines with a lustrous glow, polished enough to be ideal for dancing. A broad set of double oak doors leads from the ballroom to the hall's foyer. In the corner, a harper and flutist stand aside nondescriptly, playing gentle melodies.

node.name: Konezu's Lenses, Foyer
node.description: Pure white alabaster offsets a striking multihued fresco dominating the rear walls of this majestic foyer. Thirteen shimmering gaethzen lamps dangle from the edge of a circular opening midway between a naturally formed pool and the expansive dome overhead. A crystal weer telescope sits amid a framework of ironwood beams and brass machinery. The telescope's tremendous tube angles upwards, providing it access to the heavens.

node.name: Konezu's Lenses, Darkened Room
node.description: Hanging from a chain attached to the ceiling's center beam, a crude votive lamp of murky wine-colored glass spills muted illumination upon a low rosewood table. Charcoal woolen curtains and a padded bench draped with purplish-black felt enhance this shadowy atmosphere. As if escaping the darkness, an occasional draft flees whistling up a wide circular staircase.

node.name: Vori's Fine Carpentry
node.description: Neatly cut pieces of lumber are piled in the far corner of the room and wood shavings almost completely conceal the smooth floor. The shop's wares, elaborately carved racks and stands, are stacked upon a large oak table, the remainder cluttering the floor, making navigation difficult without toppling over the merchandise.

node.name: Konezu's Lenses, Atop the Catwalk
node.description: Encased in a web of interlocking panes of golden glass, the amber tinted dome affords a wide-angled perspective of the heavens. Three crescent-shaped lanterns of amber glass emit soft golden light, throwing into shadows lush plants placed about a stone staircase in large earthen pots. Crystallized in mid-game, a litter of gnome-sized shadowlings cavort amid a pile of cases. Caught in a costly game of keep-away, an extensive collection of telescopes remains in their paws.

node.name: The Cupcake Cafe, Front Porch
node.description: Multi-hued flagstone covers the floor, adding a splash of color to the glassed-in room. Bistro tables and chairs are spaced apart, just far enough so customers can sit and sample their purchases while still enjoying a private conversation. At the end of the porch, a white wicker swing hangs from the ceiling complete with extra cushions for those in need of a comfortable rest.

node.name: The Cupcake Cafe, Salesroom
node.description: Whitewashed walls are decorated with whimsical paintings of dancing cupcakes, candies and herbs to amuse shoppers as they wait in line for their purchases. Bakers in white coats and tall, puffy hats rush out from the kitchen with trays of freshly decorated baked goods trying to keep up with the day's orders. The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and tea emanates from a small cast iron stove in the corner that keeps the complimentary pots hot for customers to enjoy.

node.name: The Cupcake Cafe, Specialty Sales
node.description: Mixed in with the aroma of baking cake, the scent of assorted liquors helps to perfume the air, indicating that the confections displayed here were created with the adult customer in mind. The bakers working this area seem particularly happy with their jobs, although not very steady on their feet. Despite looking as if they've been sampling some of the special ingredients for quality control, they keep the counter constantly stocked.

node.name: Chispin's Handbills
node.description: Elegant in its simplicity, the print shop is filled with tables which are set against the bare brick walls. Fine, handwoven mats have been laid upon the floor, protecting the granite from the heavy furniture. Beyond a stone counter lies a small printing press, fairly new-looking and well cleaned. Bottles of ink are lined up nearby, their acidic smell heavy in the air. A reinforced ironwood door provides the only entrance.

node.name: The Rose of the Theatre, Attire
node.description: Bright plaid fabric hangs against one wall of the shop, serving as a backdrop for a theatrical mask decorated at the base with white silk roses tucked into small glass vials. Shelves and chests around the perimeter feature clothing and accessories. A simple curtain leads back out to the front of the store.

node.name: Theren Keep, Cell
node.description: Roughly five paces long and three wide, this barren cell is intended more as a holding area than a dwelling for long-term guests. This knowledge provides no solace, however, as stories abound of the infamous Cage of Death, reserved for the Baron's most "favored" prisoners. Useless chains hang from a granite wall where rust-colored stains scar the dull rock, and a sturdy cell door oversees the only passage in or out.

node.name: Theren Keep, Caravan Stables
node.description: Not a single horse graces the empty stables -- no saddle or harness hangs upon the wall. If chargers or warhorses ever paced these dusty grounds, they are long gone with the stalwart knights who bridled them.

node.name: Sister Nongwen's Small Storeroom
node.description: The contents of stacked boxes and opened crates surround a young sales clerk who is busily categorizing the items in a large parchment binder before placing them on sturdy storage shelves. A polished brass lantern hangs from the ceiling, affording ample light to display the wares that are available for sale.

node.name: Therenborough Orders Office, Lobby
node.description: The flickering flames of a multitude of lit candles reflect in the polish of the desk tucked into the corner. They light up this room that is both parlor to guests and the Therenborough Regional office for the Administrator of Orders. A pair of stools is pushed up against the smooth plaster wall where various documents hang to either side of a small oval window. Narrow hallways spanning east and west flank a wide staircase whose curve leads to the upper floors.

node.name: Therenborough Orders Office, Recruitment Hall
node.description: Simplicity seems to be the decorating order of the day in this hallway. The walls are soft grey-white and rather plain, bare of any decoration save a single mirror hanging from a small, inscribed picture hook. Reflecting the world around, the etched circle only emphasizes the elementary decor. Notwithstanding the artistry of the mirror, the dominant feature here is the set of ornate archways each of which boasts a pair of heavy curtains and a small plaque indicating the Order within.

node.name: Therenborough Orders Office, Recruitment Hall
node.description: Simplicity seems to be the decorating order of the day in this hallway. The walls are soft grey-white and rather plain, bare of any decoration save a single painting hanging from a small, inscribed picture hook. Notwithstanding the elementary decor, the dominant feature here is the set of ornate archways each of which boasts a pair of heavy curtains.

node.name: Therenborough Orders Office, Theren Guard Recruitment Room
node.description: Placed above the archway is a massive gold and black shield etched with the vivid image of a mighty dragon and loosely draped with a banner of scarlet silk. Against the far wall, a heavy wooden stand supports a box fastened with a polished lock. Above a nearby table hangs a brass plaque shimmering softly in the available light.

node.name: Lasa Morit Livery, Stable
node.description: Muffled by a thick bed of straw, the sound of stomping hooves echoes from several of the roomy box stalls extending along both sides of the spacious stable. The overwhelming musk that is pure horse mingles with the scent of saddle soap, warm leather, and hay dust to create the distinctive atmosphere that is common to all well run stables. Soothing reassurances follow in the wake of a young stable hand attempting to escort a high-strung stallion to the stable yard.

node.name: Lasa Morit Livery, Tack Room
node.description: Large hooks supporting tack in various stages of construction and repair line the walls of this bright and airy room. A low-slung rail runs between two worn benches, creating an easy spot to sling saddles while giving them a proper cleaning. Occasional breezes filter through the open window overlooking the paddock outside. Tucked behind the open door, several shelves hold an overflowing array of grooming tools.

node.name: Lasa Morit Livery, Broker's Office
node.description: A large framed map of Elanthia's trade routes overshadows the presence of a small tidy desk situated in the center of the room. Carefully filed documents fill the oak cabinets lining the wall behind the desk, each with a large locking mechanism that is kept secured at all times. Hushed voices deliberate over the finer points of a contract before the scritching sound of quill being put to document indicates yet another sale to be recorded.

node.name: Theren Guard Headquarters, Courtyard
node.description: Wild grape vines spider the base of the battlement-capped walls that surround the sprawling, well-tended grounds. Amid neatly trimmed hedges, alabaster statues of armored knights line the broad flagstone walkway that traverses the courtyard and encircles a sunken marble pool, a towering gryphon sculpture at its center. A pair of semi-circular marble benches provides a leisurely place to chat or to simply take in the beauty of the landscape. Built within the eastern wall is the two-story riverstone Order house, it's ironwood double doors bearing ornately crested shields, while a nearby arbored archway leads further into the area.

Wild grape vines spider the base of the battlement-capped walls that surround the sprawling, well-tended grounds. Amid neatly trimmed hedges, alabaster statues of armored knights bearing gaethzen swords light the broad flagstone walkway that traverses the courtyard and encircles a sunken marble pool, a towering gryphon sculpture at its center. A pair of semi-circular marble benches provides a leisurely place to chat or to simply enjoy the evening stars overhead. A soft glow is cast from the windows of the two-story riverstone Order house built within the eastern wall, it's ironwood double doors bearing ornately crested shields, while a nearby arbored archway leads further into the area.

node.name: Theren Guard Headquarters, Kenman Hall
node.description: Polished ivory sandstone surrounds the spacious hall with ornate blind arcades set within the walls, one highlighting a tall statue of an Elven knight, the others displaying suits of armor. Flanked by a pair of satin standards, a broad chandelier hangs overhead, its soft glow drawing attention to the dramatic mosaic worked within the marble floor. Surrounding the intricate design are a trio of walnut-framed settees and a decorative tea table, all overlooking the grand fireplace upon the southern wall. A spiraling stone stairwell in a nearby corner leads to the upper rooms of the house.

node.name: Theren Guard Headquarters, Baron Jeladric Theren Memorial Arena
node.note: Baron Jeladric Theren Memorial Arena|Memorial Arena
node.description: Highlighted by the glow of the gaethzen orbs, a towering memorial statue stands outside the Order House, overlooking the vast landscape with its colorful pennants fluttering from atop the enclosing riverstone walls. Along the northern side of the grounds stands two, ringed targets while the opposing side bears a full jousting arena with a set of double-sided bleachers separating the two and allowing an excellent view of either tournament's fanfare. In the distance, a small stable is enclosed within a large paddock where several of the Order's stock graze leisurely.

node.name: Theren Guard Headquarters, The Lion's Den Lounge
node.description: Richly-grained mahogany surrounds the spacious lounge, the full-length windows that overlook the arena flanking the grand marble fireplace where several tufted leather armchairs invite a relaxing chat by the fire. Rich oil paintings, vibrant tapestries and a colorful dartboard adorn the walls while delectable aromas mingle throughout the area from the kitchen door tucked behind the polished flamewood bar spanning the southern wall. A massive chandelier overhead creates a soft glowing ambience to the area, highlighting the statued pedestal tables below and etched glass display case nearby.

node.name: Theren Guard Headquarters, Gathering Hall
node.description: A soft woolen rug patterned with an intricate design runs the length of the spacious room underfoot, while burgundy satin brocades drape the walls beneath the ornate acanth leaf moldings. Highlighted by the gaethzen chandelier overhead, a grand marble fireplace crackles with a warm fire at the far end of the room, while a large mural detailing the Order crest hangs on display on a nearby wall. Tufted velvet settees surround a low table at the center of the room, overlooking the ornately-framed paintings and gracefully-arched windows that provide a stunning view of the aerial meditation garden beyond.

node.name: Theren Guard Headquarters, Aerial Meditation Garden
node.description: The daylight sky radiates through the glass dome overhead, creating an ideal year-round environment for the abundance of trees and redolent blossoms that teem throughout the massive atrium. Surrounding the garden is a multi-hued fieldstone parapet bearing gryphon-shaped piercings that overlook the surrounding community. In a quiet area along the far side of the atrium is a silver telescope, while a central fountain is encompassed by a pair of semi-circular benches, a frequent stop for those perusing the volumes on the nearby bookshelf.

node.name: Theren Guard Headquarters, Commander's Office
node.description: Rich crimson brocades drape the polished copperwood walls at measured intervals, highlighting the towering built-in bookcases and elaborate sconces that surround the expansive office. Against the far wall, a majestic gryphon's head fireplace burns with a warm fire, overlooking the semi-circular tables that radiate from either side of a large Commander's desk, nearly making a complete circle around the tasseled rug that blankets the center of the room.

node.name: Natatio, Diving Platform
node.description: The diving platform is made of a roughened stone surface which extends over the lip of the pool. The water seems a very long way down.

node.name: Natatio, Sunken Pool
node.description: The water is alive with activity. Some are swimming laps in cordoned off lanes. The younger children of the Therenborough, with their mothers nearby, play in the shallow end while the slightly older boys and girls take turns jumping from the various heights of the diving platforms. A dwarven lifeguard scowls at everyone from his chair and one wonders how exactly he got his job.

node.name: The Breech Tunnels
node.description: A rusted pick finds itself married to the rock by time and age in this section of the tunnel. Left in haste by its former owner, the handle broken off, it provides a legacy to the assault that led to the creation of these tunnels. A small hole in the east side of the rock wall reveals a deep secret darkness. Fire burns in troughs cut along the walls close to the ceiling.

node.name: The Breech Tunnels
node.description: Puffs of dust rise up with every movement in this low compartment. A strange writing is barely visible on the wall to the south, and so faded any effort to read or decipher it would be fruitless.

node.name: The Breech Tunnels
node.description: Sharp cornered rocks extending from the wall of this roughly cut, narrow tunnel make movement difficult. Pale moonlight seeps into the area from an exit to the north.

node.name: The Breech Tunnels
node.description: In the darkness you find it difficult to keep your eyes adjusted either to see in the shadows or to keep them open to the brightness of the fire troughs along the ceiling at the bottom. A faint skittering sound emerges from the deep reaches of the tunnel causing you to hesitate just momentarily.

node.name: The Breech Tunnels
node.description: This portion of the tunnel is very dark and cold. Without light, it is difficult to tell what the rubble sealing the tunnel is made of. As the tunnels decends down, it is a quick assumption that this is the top of the tunnel and therefore a way out, but for the time being that will have to remain an assumption.

node.name: The Breech Tunnels
node.description: Anyone with a fear of closed in spaces would find themselves very uncomfortable in this section of the tunnel. The claustrophic atmosphere of the narrow passage is heightened by the eerie silver moonlight seeping in from the north.

node.name: The Breech Tunnels
node.description: This end of the tunnel would continue north were it not for a tremendous amount of boulders and other rubble blocking any further passage. A slight puff of air drifts in with the light once in a while, alerting you to the fact you must be close to the outside.

node.name: The Breech Tunnels
node.description: Movement and occasional skittering noises from the shadows suggests that there is something living in these darkened passages. You can only hope that whatever it is, it isn't hungry.

node.name: The Breech Tunnels
node.description: Light drifts up from a hole in the floor of this section of the tunnel. Wide enough to crawl through, you approach the hole cautiously, not knowing if the surrounding area can hold your weight or not. The smell of something aweful seems to be carried up with the light. The scent causes you to look around briefly in the shadows to see if something has died up here.

node.name: Calidarium, Sunken Bath
node.description: The water is almost scalding hot and most who jump in get out just as quickly. A Gor'Tog relaxing in a corner shows no signs of discomfort. He watches with a puzzled and amused expression the antics going on around him. A young Human paladin sits across the way. He is in obvious discomfort, but for some reason chooses to remain in place.

node.name: Frigidarium, Sunken Bath
node.description: The temperature can only be a little above freezing. While it is difficult to keep from shivering uncontrollably, the water does feel both invigorating and cleansing. These must be the reasons why a large group of paladins sit chest-deep along the limestone steps. Many in fact don't look to be the slightest discomforted.

node.name: Therenborough, Carousel Family Services
node.description: A series of guarded arches line the southern wall. The complicated framework of iron and timbers spans across the ceiling. Countless gears, pulleys and weights form the strikingly complex mechanism which drives the Carousel.

node.name: Therenborough, Family Vault
node.description: A Dwarven attendant stands near the entry, doing his best to ignore you but seeming anxious. A wooden platform sits in the middle of the room, and a complicated series of gears, rope and other mechanisms are focused around it.

node.name: Theren Meeting Hall, Entrance
node.description: Made out of polished mahogany and white marble, the Theren meeting hall is pristinely clean, with columns that support an arched roof. Long golden chains hang downward to support lanterns burning gaethzen orbs, giving the hall's interior a look of burnished sunlight. Banners hang on the walls and in even intervals along the length of the long corridor, emblazoned with Therengian crests.

node.name: Theren Meeting Hall, Eastern Wing
node.description: Torches in golden sconces illuminate the hallway, set into the marble columns set into the walls and scattering bright light through the wing. Bright ash paneling covers the walls, and on them, several weapons of various types hang proudly on display. A set of narrow banners frame an arched window that looks out onto the city streets.

node.name: Theren Meeting Hall, Western Wing
node.description: The western end of the meeting hall opens up into a large circular room, lined with pedestals that display relics of battles long past. The ceiling is made from several arches that converge in the center, and the keystone supports an elegant chandelier. Pure white marble makes up the floor, with narrow strips of gold separating the perfectly square tiles.

node.name: Theren Meeting Hall, Baronial Conference Room
node.description: Vibrant tapestries depicting historical moments in Therengian history are hung at measured intervals along the richly grained mahogany walls, further emphasizing the towering built-in bookcases and ornate lion's head sconces that cast a warm glow throughout the expansive lounge. Against the far wall, polished suits of armor flank a carved mahogany podium. A settle bench rests nearby, providing the ideal spot for a peaceful chat.

node.name: Hall of Power
node.description: Carved wooden panels cover the low walls of the meeting room, and a small arrangement of Therengian roses grows in a bronze vase in one corner. Several rows of high-backed benches are arranged in the center of the room, each finely carved from sturdy mahogany and decorated with elaborate ivy vines. Large violet banners cover the walls, embroidered with images of filled pieces of cambrinth.

node.name: Hall of Justice
node.description: Carved wooden panels cover the low walls of the meeting room, and a small arrangement of Therengian roses grows in a copper vase in one corner. Several rows of high-backed benches are arranged in the center of the room, each finely carved from sturdy mahogany and decorated with elaborate ivy vines. Large white banners cover the walls, each embroidered with an image of a judge's gavel.

node.name: Hall of Honor
node.description: Carved wooden panels cover the low walls of the meeting room, and a small arrangement of Therengian roses grows in a silver vase in one corner. Several rows of high-backed benches are arranged in the center of the room, each finely carved from sturdy mahogany and decorated with elaborate ivy vines. Large blue banners cover the walls, embroidered with images of brilliant gold sunrays.

node.name: Hall of Triumph
node.description: Carved wooden panels cover the low walls of the meeting room, and a small arrangement of Therengian roses grows in a golden vase in one corner. Several rows of high-backed benches are arranged in the center of the room, each finely carved from sturdy mahogany and decorated with elaborate ivy vines. Large red banners cover the walls, embroidered with images of raised shields.

node.name: Hall of Virtue
node.description: Carved wooden panels cover the low walls of the meeting room, and a small arrangement of Therengian roses grows in a platinum vase in one corner. Several rows of high-backed benches are arranged in the center of the room, each finely carved from sturdy mahogany and decorated with elaborate ivy vines. Large yellow banners cover the walls, embroidered with images of pristine soulstones.

node.name: Therenborough, Rundmolen Post Office
node.description: Tucked up against the stone block wall is an low stone counter showing many dings and chips. Fretwork screens carved from dark woods surround the counter, sectioning it off from the rest of the square. Vast, countless rows of differently sized shelves are behind the counter, and complex Dwarven mechanisms can be heard as they rearrange the package-covered storage. Clerks shuffle endlessly back and forth between the counters and shelving as they assist patrons with their packaging and mailing needs.
